# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of 2026)  
**(Based on headline signals from last 30 days feed)**

---

## 1) Themes to watch  
- Offshore wind project developments and disputes (e.g., Orsted vs US regulatory halt, Apollo co-ownership of Hornsea 3)  
- Solar PV market dynamics balancing capacity growth and supplier challenges (China price changes, India mandates, Bangladesh tenders)  
- Grid flexibility and integration to support community solar and renewables (US state orders for flexible grid connections)  
- AI and digital innovation impacting renewables and data center efficiency (digital twin for floating PV, AI economics, Intel fab scrutiny)  
- Geopolitical tensions and risks impacting energy infrastructure security (subsea cable cut incident involving Russian crew)  
- Domestic content and manufacturing policies shaping battery storage and PV supply chains (India’s 20% domestic content mandate)  

---

## 2) What to monitor next  

### Grid / Renewables  
- US regulatory environment and policy shifts affecting offshore wind (Orsted’s challenge to US project halt)  
- Flexible grid connection policies for community solar deployment in US states  
- UK solar’s Contract-for-Difference (CfD) pipeline and deployment trajectory in 2026  
- India's expanding domestic content requirements in battery storage projects impacting supply chains  

### Oil & Gas  
- Not enough information in the headlines regarding oil & gas trends this period  

### Data Centers & AI  
- Adoption of AI-powered digital twins for floating PV optimization  
- Intel's Arizona semiconductor fab situation and implications for chip supply chain  
- Broader AI inference economics and trade viability over coming years  

### Semiconductors  
- Pricing signals from China wafer manufacturers that may influence module costs and semiconductor supply chain stress points  

### Critical Minerals  
- Not enough information in the headlines about rare earths or critical minerals explicitly  
- Potential indirect impact from India’s battery storage content rules on critical mineral sourcing  

---

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly  
- China: Leading in offshore wind turbine capacity; solar manufacturer challenges; wafer/module pricing pressure  
- US: Regulatory and market support for solar and community solar flexibility; Intel fab watch  
- India: Major solar manufacturer Waaree Energies growth; domestic content rules  
- UK: Strong solar CfD deployment expected  
- Orsted (Denmark-based) in focus for offshore wind US project issues  
- Apollo (US-based investor) increasing offshore wind ownership  
- Finland and Russia implicated in subsea cable sabotage incident  

---

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines  
- Regulatory and political obstacles impacting large-scale offshore wind projects (US vs Orsted)  
- Solar supply chain uncertainties due to manufacturer exits, pricing shifts in China  
- Energy infrastructure security threats from geopolitical actions (e.g., subsea cable sabotage)  
- Potential penalties for utilities shifting to fixed charges risking efficiency and consumer backlash  
- Market and operational risks tied to AI adoption and semiconductor fab performance outcomes  

---

*End of Forward Watchlist*
